intro: Chaseopsis aurantiaca, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Chaseopsis aurantiaca is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
